intro: Calvoa molleri, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. Calvoa molleri is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
